body_html: In an ideal world, I think we'd like to not specify data_format for the model at all. I'd like to just tag my input batch with some data format, and have the model internally run transpose operations as needed to use the fastest data format for the given platform... but this is going to be a tradeoff between the cost of transposing and the benefit of using a more optimal data format, if certain ops only support certain data formats.
body_text: In an ideal world, I think we'd like to not specify data_format for the model at all. I'd like to just tag my input batch with some data format, and have the model internally run transpose operations as needed to use the fastest data format for the given platform... but this is going to be a tradeoff between the cost of transposing and the benefit of using a more optimal data format, if certain ops only support certain data formats.
body: In an ideal world, I think we'd like to not specify `data_format` for the model at all. I'd like to just tag my input batch with some data format, and have the model internally run transpose operations as needed to use the fastest data format for the given platform... but this is going to be a tradeoff between the cost of transposing and the benefit of using a more optimal data format, if certain ops only support certain data formats.
